greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d_<n | n} sigma(d_<n), where d_<n = divisors of n that are less than n, sigma(x) = A000203(x).
comment: The numbers n < 1000 such that n divides a(n) are 4, 10, 42, and 90. (See A224488).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..27144 (first 1000 terms from Jaroslav Krizek)
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
maple: for n from 1 to q do
mathematica: Table[Sum[DivisorSigma[1, d], {d, Most[Divisors[n]]}], {n, 100}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Apr 26 2012 *)
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Apr 20 2012
